title: Report a Hate Crime Here
text:
Report a Hate Crime Here 
ELLE.com is partnering with ProPublica to give people a place to record hate crimes. Getty By ELLE.com Jan 31, 2017 In the wake of the 2016 presidential election, there were a number of stories ostensibly documenting an uptick in hate crimes. But tweets, or even statements from the Southern Poverty Law Center or the NYPD , aren't quite the same as dataâ€•and data surrounding hate crimes is notoriously hard to gather. Federal law requires that state and local law enforcement agencies be asked to report these crimes, but several agencies simply decline to report back. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below That's why ELLE.com is teaming up with ProPublica as part of Documenting Hate , a national effort to collect and verify incidents of hate crimes.
